name: WordPress G_Buzz_Button
author: Andrew Aronsky

sections.description:
• Author: Aronsky
  • Project URI: http://www.muzhiks.com/google_buzz_button_wordpress
  • License: GPL 2. See License below for copyright jots and tittles.

Adds button “Buzz this” which allows to add the reference to post in the status in Google Buzz.
Dialogue of addition of the link opens in a pop-up window.
Includes the counter of additions.

License

The WordPress G_Buzz_Button plugin is copyright © 2009 with GNU General Public License by Aronsky.

This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY
WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A
PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.

ToDo

1. More sizes and colors
2. Statistics page
3. More options
sections.installation:
System requirements

To use G_Buzz_Button, you will need:

  • an installed and configured copy of WordPress version 2.6.x, 2.5.x,
    2.3.x, 2.2.x, 2.1.x, 2.0.x, or 1.5.x. (G_Buzz_Button will also work with
    the equivalent versions of WordPress MU.)

  • FTP or SFTP access to your web host

New Installations

  1. Download the G_Buzz_Button archive in zip or gzipped tar format and
    extract the files on your computer.

  2. Create a new directory named g_buzz in the wp-content/plugins
    directory of your WordPress installation. Use an FTP or SFTP client to
    upload the contents of your WordPress G_Buzz_Button archive to the new directory
    that you just created on your web host.

  3. Log in to the WordPress Dashboard and activate the G_Buzz_Button plugin.

  4. Configure the plugin and add it to the plugin settings page.

Updating

  1. Download the G_Buzz_Button archive in zip or gzipped tar format and
    extract the files on your computer.

  2. Deactivate old version G_Buzz_Button.

  3. Delete a folder containing G_Buzz_Button from a folder ‘wp-content/plugins’.

  4. Create a new directory named g_buzz in the wp-content/plugins
    directory of your WordPress installation. Use an FTP or SFTP client to
    upload the contents of your WordPress G_Buzz_Button archive to the new directory
    that you just created on your web host.

  5. Log in to the WordPress Dashboard and activate the G_Buzz_Button plugin.

  6. Configure the plugin and add it to the plugin settings page.
sections.faq:
Why the text on button is allocated not on centre?

Most likely it because of a font size. Correct value “padding” in the field “Custom Text CSS” in options “Google Buzz”.
sections.changelog:
1.1

  1. Now from one IP one voice for each article is set off only. All IP are saved in a database that will allow to work with statistics.
  2. Support of old versions WordPress (including 2.6) Is added.
  3. New icons are added. Look at the screenshot.
  4. Small errors are corrected.
  5. The algorithm of operation is improved.
  6. Function of removal of a plug-in Is added.
  7. New options are added. Look at the screenshot.

1.0.1

In an automatic mode the button is added only on post page.

1.0

Plugin release. Operate all the basic functions.
